utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m telling you, if xenon emits ultraviolet light, then those dark matter discoveries must be wrong.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, well, if we lived in a world where slow-moving xenon produced light, then you’d be correct. Also, pigs would fly, my derriere would produce cotton candy, and The Phantom Menace would be a timeless classic.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, you’re so arrogant. If you were a superhero, your name would be Captain Arrogant. And you know what your superpower would be? Arrogance.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re wrong again. If my superpower were arrogance, my name would be Dr. Arroganto.

utterance.speaker: Howard (laughs)
utterance.content: I love watching Raj and Sheldon try to work together.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s like if Alien and Predator decided to go partners in a Jamba Juice.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Has it occurred to you you’re missing the big picture? If you look at neutron scattering data…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, Penny? Penny?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nothing. I just wanted to make Raj stop talking.

utterance.speaker: Howard (after Raj whispers to him)
utterance.content: No, no, no. He won. Suck it up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I’d ask you guys if you want dessert, but I know Sheldon doesn’t eat dessert on Tuesdays. And even if Raj wanted something, he couldn’t tell me. Howard won’t order anything, but he will come up with some sort of skeevy comment involving the words pie or cheesecake. And Leonard’s lactose intolerant, so he can’t eat anything here without his intestines blowing up like a balloon animal.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hang on a second. I could have the fruit platter.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You want the fruit platter?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Does it have melon on it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I can’t eat melon.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Howard, heads up. Your ex-girlfriend just came in for her shift.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw her?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, not since we broke up. Wow. How am I going to play this? Sophisticated and relaxed? Friendly, noncommittal? Cold and distant? .

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hi, guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello. I see you decided to go with pathetic and frightened.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s one of his best moves.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, my dear, we meet again.

utterance.speaker: Katee Sackhoff
utterance.content: Hello, Howard. I’ve missed you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ve missed you, Katee Sackhoff.

utterance.speaker: Katee Sackhoff
utterance.content: One question.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Anything.

utterance.speaker: Katee Sackhoff
utterance.content: Why am I wearing my Battlestar Galactica flight suit in bed?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why are you in bed with me? If we start to question this, it all falls apart.

utterance.speaker: Katee Sackhoff
utterance.content: Sorry. Oh, ravish me, Howard. My loins ache for you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, if you insist.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Howard, have you seen my girdle?!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, Ma!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: I can’t find it, and I’m late for my Weight Watchers meeting!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe it committed suicide! Leave me alone! Now, where were we?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I believe you were about to rip off my uniform with your teeth.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernadette? What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Katee Sackhoff
utterance.content: Well, if I had to guess, I’d say I’m here because you saw me earlier this evening, and you’re still hung up on me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, I’m not.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Clearly you are. Otherwise, based on past experience, we’d be done by now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, I’m a little confused here.

utterance.speaker: George Takei
utterance.content: Oh, my. Can I help?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not that kind of confused.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What’s George Takei doing here?

utterance.speaker: Katee Sackhoff
utterance.content: Howard, do you have latent homosexual tendencies?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, of course not.

utterance.speaker: George Takei
utterance.content: So you say. Yet, here I am.

utterance.speaker: Katee Sackhoff
utterance.content: George, let me ask you something. How did you deal with being typecast as a science fiction icon?

utterance.speaker: George Takei
utterance.content: It’s difficult. You try and stretch as an actor, do Strindberg, O’Neill, but all they want is, Course laid in, Captain.

utterance.speaker: Katee Sackhoff
utterance.content: Tell me about it. It’s frackin’ frustrating.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait. Katee, why are you leaving?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: She’s leaving because you really want to be with me.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: Howard, I found my girdle! It was in the dryer!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great, Ma!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
utterance.content: I think it shrunk! I’m spilling out like the Pillsbury Doughboy here!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And with that mental picture, I think we’re done for the evening.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, you never told me what happened between you and Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I did a stupid thing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I guessed that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It was the kind of thing that makes it kind of hard to face her now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That covers anything from farting in bed to killing a homeless guy. Oh, my God. You ran over a hobo.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. Stop asking.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, fine. So you want to get back together with her, but you’re too ashamed to face her because of whatever it is you did.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: In a nutshell.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. Well, how about this? Kidnap Bernadette from the opera wearing a creepy mask so she doesn’t know it’s you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Now, you see, I don’t know if you’re kidding or not.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re being unreasonable. Why can’t I have a desk?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Our collaboration is a work of the mind. We don’t need desks.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You have a desk.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Correct.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But I can’t have one.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re two for two.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why can’t he have a desk, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, Lord, will this day never end? As I’ve explained repeatedly to Dr. Koothrappali, whose ability to comprehend the American idiom fails him when it’s convenient, there’s absolutely no money in my budget for additional office furniture.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, but there’s money for a drawer full of Red Vines, a marshmallow shooting rifle, and a super executive ant farm with glow-in-the-dark sand?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, what if he buys his own desk?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, what if I buy my own desk?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s my office.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, all right. He can buy his own desk.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And I can put it in your office?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you really want to dot the I’s and cross the T’s, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would you want a glow-in-the-dark ant farm?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They do some of their best work at night.

utterance.speaker: Penny (picking up a top and sniffing it)
utterance.content: Ah, it’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice)
utterance.content: Penny? Penny? Penny? Penny?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Would you have opened the door if you knew it was me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not since I found out the teddy bear you gave me had a webcam in it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I just have a question. Does Bernadette ever talk about me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She does?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. Just yesterday, she asked, why is Howard hiding under the table?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She saw that, huh?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no, not at first. Right after I pointed it out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let me ask you something else. Is she seeing anybody?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, not that I know of. Hey, while we’re on the subject, why did you guys break up anyway?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I’d rather not say.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Howard, if you want my help, I’ve got to know what happened.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But it’s embarrassing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s what I’m counting on. Spill.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay. Well, you know World of Warcraft?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, the online game? Sure.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, did you know that the characters in the game can have sex with each other?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, God. I think I see where this is going.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Her name was Glissinda the Troll. Bernadette walked in on me while we were doing the cyber-nasty under the Bridge of Souls.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, you’re right. That is so embarrassing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Would you talk to her?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Bernadette or the troll?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernadette. She was so mad at me, she wouldn’t even listen to my side of the story.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, what was your side?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, for all we know, Glissinda the Troll wasn’t even a real woman. I mean, she could’ve been a 50-year-old truck driver in New Jersey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? And that didn’t make her feel better?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Will you talk to her, see if there’s any chance at all we could get back together?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, gee, Howard, I really don’t want to get in the middle of this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. Why would you? I’m just another lonely nerd, living with his mother, trying to find any scrap of happiness he can. You know, maybe to make up for the fact that his dad left him when he was 11.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I will think about it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, I’ve always blamed myself for him leaving. I always thought it was because I wasn’t the son he wanted.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I said I’d think about it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I wasn’t athletic, yeah, I was kind of sickly.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Look, look, I’m calling her now! See?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So anyway, Howard asked Penny to talk to Bernadette, and she did, and Bernadette agreed to meet him for a cup of coffee.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: One question.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why on earth are you telling me all this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Sometimes your movements are so lifelike, I forget you’re not a real boy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You said I could buy a desk.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This isn’t a desk. This is a Brobdingnagian monstrosity.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is that the American idiom for giant, big-ass desk?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s actually British.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can you say it again for me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Brobdingnagian.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: One more time?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Brobdingnagian.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Now three times fast?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Brobdingnagian, Brobdingna… How did you even get it in here?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s for me, Ramon, Julio, Jesus and Rodrigo to know and you to find out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, you’ve made your point. A fine prank, very amusing. Now get it out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I have three brothers and two sisters, Sheldon, I can do this all day.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, if you’re not going to remove it, I’ll remove it for you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Knock yourself out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Help me move my desk.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No. It’s too Brobdingnagian.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why do you even want this here? Its size is completely disproportionate to its purpose.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, seeing as its purpose was to piss you off, I’d say it’s spot-on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, I see what’s going on. This is the opening salvo in what will be an escalating series of juvenile tit-for-tat exchanges. Well titted.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Stand by for my upcoming tat.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No. See what I did there? I turned it around.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sorry, I had to clock out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, no, that’s okay. How have you been?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay. You know, busy, school, work. You?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Same. I took a scuba-diving course over the summer, but it turns out I’m terrified of the ocean.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Too bad.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You wouldn’t know anybody who wants to buy a wet suit, boy’s large? Yeah, forget it. Not important. So, are you seeing anyone?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, to be honest, I…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, how are we doing over here? Can I get you something to drink?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not for me, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m okay.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you gonna want to order food?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe later.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, are you seeing anybody?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s what I told him when he asked me. I hope that’s not out of line.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, it’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Penny, can we have a little privacy?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What about you, have you been seeing anybody?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, you know how it is with guys. I mean, we have needs and…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So you’ve been seeing other girls?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, not real girls.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Does that mean slutty trolls?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, you look thirsty. I brought you some iced tea.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s passion fruit, new on the menu.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I know. I work here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, sorry. Yeah, you’re right. Doy. So, Howard, trolls, yay or nay?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Isn’t there somewhere else you can be?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not where I can hear you guys.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, fine. I’ll admit, there are dark, sordid little corners of the Internet where the name Wolowizard is whispered in hushed tones. But the only reason I go there, the only reason I’ve ever gone there is because I don’t have a real woman in my life. You happy?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, that’ll hold me for a while.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard, you did have a real woman. I was right there in the next room while you were clicking that troll’s brains out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, but we weren’t, I-I mean, you and I never…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Had sex?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, whose fault was that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Complimentary nachos! You enjoy. Never had sex? Wow.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What do you mean, whose fault was that?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, we could’ve been having sex, but you never made the move.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I didn’t think you wanted me to make the move.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard, a girl doesn’t go out with a man like you, with your looks, your fancy patter and your tight hoochie pants if she’s not expecting him to eventually make the move.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Really.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Son of a bitch.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, this is a little awkward, but my manager says I can’t actually give nachos away. So, just take that when you’re ready.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, we had a really great talk, and we’re gonna start seeing each other again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, congratulations. Have you broken it to the troll yet?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Did Penny tell you about that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. Steve Patterson told me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The greasy old fat guy in Facilities Management?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How’d he know about it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s Glissinda the troll.

utterance.speaker: Raj (voice)
utterance.content: Sorry, dude, the thermostat’s on my side of the room, so it stays Mumbai hot in here until you turn off that stupid Indian music!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice)
utterance.content: I’ll turn off the music when you get rid of that salmonella-ridden parakeet!

utterance.speaker: Raj (voice)
utterance.content: Oh, too bad! Sheldon’s pathologically afraid of birds! Hey, look, Sheldon! Birdie, birdie, birdie!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (voice)
utterance.content: That’s it! Prepare for marshmallow death!

utterance.speaker: Raj (voice)
utterance.content: Eat flaming Nerf!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So anyway, that’s great news about you and Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. I think I’m gonna take her to miniature golf.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ah. Well, I guess for you guys that’s like regular golf.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Short jokes? Really? You’re, like, a quarter of an inch taller than me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, and don’t you forget it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I had a good time.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Me, too.

utterance.speaker: Katee Sackhoff
utterance.content: Kiss her good night. All right, now a little tongue.

utterance.speaker: George Takei
utterance.content: Hold on there. We’ve only just rekindled the romance. Let’s not sully the moment with the exchange of saliva.

utterance.speaker: Katee Sackhoff
utterance.content: Don’t listen to him. She wants it. Tongue. Luh-luh-luh-luh-luh. See? Now make the move.

utterance.speaker: George Takei
utterance.content: Mm-mmm. Too soon.

utterance.speaker: Katee Sackhoff
utterance.content: Trust me, she’s ready. Make the move.

utterance.speaker: George Takei
utterance.content: No, no, no. A lady wants to be wooed, courted slowly.

utterance.speaker: Katee Sackhoff
utterance.content: How would you know?

utterance.speaker: George Takei
utterance.content: I read.

utterance.speaker: Katee Sackhoff
utterance.content: Listen to me, Howard, it’s time. Make the move, now.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Mm! What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You said, well, the move, remember?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, not now. We’re starting a new relationship. I need to get to know you again.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, you don’t. It’s me. The lusty charmer with the fancy patter and the hoochie pants.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Be patient, we’ll get there.

utterance.speaker: George Takei
utterance.content: Told you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, God, what’s that smell? . Oh-ho-hoo!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing in there?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m making hydrogen sulphide and ammonia gas. Just a little experiment in pest control.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s not gonna work, dude, I grew up in India, an entire subcontinent where cows walk in the street, and nobody has ever had a solid bowel movement.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, we’ll just see how long you can hold out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, we’ll just see how your noxious gas fares against my cinnamon-apple-scented aroma therapy candles.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Didn’t you say you’re making hydrogen sulphide gas?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Isn’t that flammable?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Highly. Oh, dear.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This is not over.
